intro: Ptychosperma noxa, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to coastal regions of Australia and is adapted to saline and waterlogged soils. The plant has dark, almost black, bark and produces small, clustered inflorescences of white flowers. Its fruits are globose and contain a single seed, which is dispersed by water. Ptychosperma noxa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
